info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN INDIANA AND SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Punxsutawney, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Reynoldsville, Sykesville, Falls Creek, Big Run, and Rossiter. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 92 and 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
